data.content: Diseña uno para una tienda de ordenadores que atienda dudas generales y gestione reservas. El bot debe permitir reservar para recoger un equipo o para reparación. Si es reparación, solo se pide el problema. Si es recogida, debe preguntar la fecha (la tienda abre de 8 a 19 h), el tipo y cantidad (máximo 5 por tipo). Modelos: portátiles ($900), sobremesas ($1200), estaciones de trabajo ($2000) y mini PCs ($700). El bot debe calcular el total. El flujo puede no ser perfecto, pero debe cubrir todo.

Based on your request for a Taskyto chatbot for a computer store that handles general inquiries and manages reservations, I will create the necessary YAML files. The chatbot will allow users to reserve for pickup or repair, gather the required information, and calculate totals based on the selected models and quantities.

Here are the YAML files for your Taskyto project:

```yaml
# -----> File: top_level.yaml <-----
modules:
- name: top-level
  kind: menu
  presentation: |
    Welcome to the Computer Store chatbot! I can help you with general inquiries and manage reservations for pickups or repairs.
  fallback: I'm sorry, I didn't understand that. Could you please rephrase?

  items:
  - title: General Inquiries
    kind: module
    reference: general_inquiries
  - title: Make a Reservation
    memory: full
    kind: module
    reference: reservation_flow
```

```yaml
# -----> File: general_inquiries.yaml <-----
name: general_inquiries
kind: question_answering
description: This module answers general questions about the computer store.
questions:
- question: What models do you have?
  answer: We have laptops ($900), desktops ($1200), workstations ($2000), and mini PCs ($700).
- question: What are your opening hours?
  answer: We are open from 8 AM to 7 PM every day.
- question: How can I contact you?
  answer: You can contact us via email at support@computerstore.com or call us at (555) 123-4567.
```

```yaml
# -----> File: reservation_flow.yaml <-----
name: reservation_flow
kind: menu
presentation: |
  Please choose whether you want to reserve for pickup or repair.
fallback: I'm sorry, I didn't understand that. Could you please rephrase?

items:
- title: Reserve for Pickup
  memory: full
  kind: sequence
  references:
    - pickup_details
    - calculate_total
- title: Reserve for Repair
  memory: full
  kind: sequence
  references:
    - repair_details
    - calculate_total
```

```yaml
# -----> File: pickup_details.yaml <-----
name: pickup_details
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  Please provide the date for pickup (store opens from 8 AM to 7 PM) and the details of the models you want to reserve.
data:
  - pickup_date: date
  - model_type:
      type: enum
      values:
        - laptop
        - desktop
        - workstation
        - mini_pc
  - quantity:
      type: integer
      required: true

on-success:
  response:
    text: "You have reserved {quantity} {model_type}(s) for pickup on {pickup_date}."
    rephrase: simple
```

```yaml
# -----> File: repair_details.yaml <-----
name: repair_details
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  Please describe the problem with your device for repair.
data:
  - problem_description: string

on-success:
  response:
    text: "Thank you for providing the details about your problem: {problem_description}. We will contact you soon."
    rephrase: simple
```

```yaml
# -----> File: calculate_total.yaml <-----
name: calculate_total
kind: action
data:
  - model_type:
      type: enum
      values:
        - laptop
        - desktop
        - workstation
        - mini_pc
  - quantity:
      type: integer

on-success:
  execute:
    language: python
    code: |
      prices = {
          "laptop": 900,
          "desktop": 1200,
          "workstation": 2000,
          "mini_pc": 700
      }
      total = prices[model_type] * quantity
      return f"The total cost for {quantity} {model_type}(s) is ${total}."
  response:
    text: "{result}"
    rephrase: simple
```

These YAML files define the structure and flow of your Taskyto chatbot for the computer store. You can copy and paste them into your Taskyto project. If you need further modifications or additional features, feel free to ask!
